    • Method Detail

      • getLengthOfLongestSide

        public int getLengthOfLongestSide(int spliceIndex)

      • splice

        public PairIntArray[] splice(int[] spliceIndexInOut)
        splice the edge at spliceIndex and return the 2 pieces as the longest edge then the other. Note that the splice index is in the longer edge, so spliceIndexInOut gets populated with the value w.r.t. the first item returned.
        Returns:

      • splice

        public PairIntArray[] splice(int[] spliceIndexInOut,
                             java.util.Set<java.lang.Integer> edgePixelIndexes,
                             java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,PairInt> editJunctionLocationMap,
                             java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,PairInt> outputSmallerSpliceJunctionLocationMap,
                             java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,PairInt> outputLargerSpliceJunctionLocationMap)
        splice the edge at spliceIndexInOut and return the splices ordered by the largest splice as item 0. spliceIndexInOut is updated with respect to item 0 and the editJunctionMap is edited for any location value affected by the splice.
        Parameters:
        spliceIndexInOut - variable to give splice index and return the updated value with respect to the first item in the spliced edge
        editJunctionLocationMap - map w/ key = pixel index and value = edge location pair (edges index, index within edge). (can be null).
        edgePixelIndexes - pixel indexes of junctions within this edge. Note, it's up to the invoker to validate that the input is for this same edge. (can be null).
        outputLargerSpliceJunctionLocationMap - (can be null if edgePixelIndexes is null)
        outputSmallerSpliceJunctionLocationMap - (can be null if edgePixelIndexes is null)
        Returns:
        PairIntArray[]{largerSplice, smallerSplice} along with side effect of spliceIndexInOut[0] updated w.r.t. largerSplice and outputLargerSpliceJunctionLocationMap and outputSmallerSpliceJunctionLocationMap containing their entries from editJunctionLocationMap updated for the splice. (editJunctionLocationMap is not updated directly, just in case the splice isn't used by the invoker).
